result.execSummary:
The defendant Shay Drayontay Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs, including the Domestic Abuse Surcharge.  Bond money is to be applied.  The balance of bond money is to be returned to the poster.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shay Drayontay Wells

records.addlTxt: 15C  016689, remailed to new Eau Claire, WI address.

William Nemer for the State; Def did not appear.  State moves for warrant and forfeiture of bond.  Court grants motion.  10:07 am:  William Nemer for the State; Def appeared in person.  Court cancels warrant and reinstates bond.  Court advised Def of rights.  Def KVI waives all rights.  Court finds Def KVI waives all rights.  Def enters plea.  Court finds Def G.  Def sentenced.

Pre-trial conference at 02-09-2015 10:00 am.
Status Conference at 02-19-2015 09:00 am.

Defendant, Shay Drayontay Wells, appeared.  Taavi McMahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised defendant of  rights.  Defendant KVI waives rights and enters plea of not guilty.  Matter to be set for PTC and STC.  Bond cont.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status Conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
